text:
What's up everyone? Today we are learning
vocabulary related to the workplace

with the incredible movie
The Devil Wears Prada.

So this movie is great to learn how to
be polite

and professional in the workplace,
because Meryl Streep

is in fact the complete opposite
in her role as Miranda Priestly.

She is the editor-in-chief
of Runway Magazine,

and it's believed that her role is based
on Anna Wintour,

editor-in-chief of Vogue Magazine.
In case you're new here, I want to let

you know that every week
we make lessons to help you

learn fast English.
Without getting lost, without missing the

jokes and without subtitles.
In fact, Kavindra says that our channel

is the best way to learn pronunciation
and connected speech.

So don't forget to hit that Subscribe button
and the Bell down below,

so that you don't miss
any of our new lessons!

Do you struggle to understand
fast speaking natives?

Then I highly recommend
our Fluent with Friends course.
In this 48-week course you will learn

with the first two seasons of Friends.
You'll receive PDF Power Lessons every week,
vocabulary memorization software,

access to our Fluency Circle
Global Community, and so much more.

And did you know? You can try it right now,
for FREE with our 3-Part Masterclass!

All you have to do is click up here or
in the description box below to learn

more and sign up now.
We hope to see you there!

If you're enjoying this lesson, then I
highly recommend you check out our

lesson with Sandra Bullock
in "The Blind Side",

where you can learn how to
give advice in English.

You can click up here or in the
description box below to watch it next.
